meanings.definition: The quality or state of being rugged or rough in texture or appearance.
meanings.sent1: The ruggednesses of the mountain terrain made hiking difficult.
meanings.sent2: The hiker admired the ruggednesses of the rocky cliffs.
meanings.sent3: The artist exaggerated the ruggednesses of the landscape in their painting.
meanings.sent4: The ruggednesses of the old castle walls told stories of battles long past.
meanings.sent5: The ruggednesses of the tree bark felt like rough sandpaper against his palm.

meanings.definition: The ability to withstand harsh conditions or rough treatment.
meanings.sent1: The ruggednesses of the boots kept his feet dry in the rain.
meanings.sent2: The durability of the fabric showed its ruggednesses during the outdoor expedition.
meanings.sent3: The ruggednesses of the phone case saved his device from a fall.
meanings.sent4: Her determination and ruggednesses in the face of challenges inspired others.
meanings.sent5: The ruggednesses of the old bridge stood strong against the raging river.
